title: Episode 58 - "Terminal"
synopsis: Space Ghost diagnoses himself with a terminal illness and tries to convince guest star Dr. Drew to let him take his clothes off. We also discover that Zorak likes sad piano music in this "whacked-out" episode.(Synopsis by Sinko)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm sorry about this, but I can't help it. And I can't talk to you two long or I'll get upset. (sobs) I want you two to make a lot of friends, and I want you to be real nice to the girls, 'cause they're going to be real important to you soon. I swear.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We're not afraid of girls, what makes you think that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You may be later on.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I doubt it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Why don't you shut up? Shut up!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You shut up!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You be sweet. Be sweet! And stop trying to pretend that you hate me. I mean, that's silly.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I like you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay then. Will you listen especially close? I know you like me. I know it. For the last two years you've been pretending like you hate me. I love you very much. I love you as much as I love anybody. I, I love you as much as I love myself. (piano music swells in background) In a few years when I haven't been around to be on your tail about something or irritating you, you're gonna remember. You're gonna remember the time I bought you the baseball glove, when you thought we were too broke. Or when I read you stories. When I let you goof off instead of mowing the lawn. Lots of things like that. And you're gonna realize that you loved me, and maybe you'll feel bad because you never told me. I know that you love me.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I love this song!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, I'm Space Ghost. And I have a very important annoucement to make concerning my death. (sighs) Ladies and gentlemen, I, Space Ghost, am dying.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: So, are you gonna go to your desk?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (distraught) I can't.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Why not?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Or it may be my last time. Soon, I will no longer be bound to this -

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (shouts) Move it!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) I'm gonna miss this part. (invisos to desk) (way-outs stop playing) I love that part. (sniffs and sobs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, can I have your cape?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I need my cape.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Not where you're going. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sobs quietly with hand over his face)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Would you feel better if I jabbed you in the eye?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stops sobbing) No, I feel okay.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: How about a head butt?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, no thank you. (sobs again) It's just there's so many things I haven't done with my life.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Like what?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Like what?! Well, for one thing, I've never ridden on a barge. And, I've never met Boomer Esiason. It's all so unfair! (choir voices swell in background; Space Ghost flies into space) I've never even eaten an omelet. (flies back to his desk) Oh well, surely there are omelets in heaven.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: What makes you so sure you're going to heaven?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, whatever. As long as they have omelets.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You're just makin' this up so we'll feel bad for ya!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Frankly, Zorak, that's offensive. Like I would make up such a thing. (coughs twice, very unconvincingly) See, you hear that? It won't be long now.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, um, what's gonna happen to us?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, you're free to go. Isn't that great?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (stares wide-eyed)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Really?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No. (laughs) You're part of a franchise. And by the end of tonight's show, we'll have my replacement. So to get that going, bring in my first guest.

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: (lowers on monitor, in "Weinerville" miniature person set) Aha! Joey Deluxe, super-agent.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, Joey. I understand you represent top-notch talent.

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: That's right!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Joey, I need your help. I've been diagnosed as one who is near death.

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: (trying to keep his toupe from falling off) I'd like to help you out, but I got a little problem of my own right now.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Joey, do you have any ideas of who could replace me as host of this show? I know it's a tall order.

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: (his toupe falls over his face) Space Ghost! Ah, oh boy! Help me! It's, it's an alien, it's takin' over my face!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, it should be someone just like me, only not dead.

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: Ah, fantastic! Was that a joke?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Very serious, Joey.

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: What an operation.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, can you help me?

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: Ha ha! Fantastic!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fantastic!

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: Fantastic! Ow! Ow! Ahh! (toupe falls off again) (fades from monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fantastic!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (glares)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) I really love these cards. They're a part of me. They've been along for the ride. (tap tap tap) What a ride it has been. (tap) I'd do it all over again if I could, but next time there would be a little Space Ghost to extend the family line.

transcript.speaker: Roy Allen
transcript.dialogue: (sobbing)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's the matter, Roy Allen?

transcript.speaker: Roy Allen
transcript.dialogue: (sobbing) I didn't hit the ball today!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, there's plenty of other balls in the sea, son. Besides, you're not very talented. Ya have no hand-eye coordination.

transcript.speaker: Roy Allen
transcript.dialogue: (continues sobbing)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, Moltar, listen up (Choir voices swell in background) When I inviso out -- all the way out -- I want to be buried right here, in the studio.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, what if you don't die?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, that would be good for me, Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No, I mean, what if you just go into a coma or somthing. What then? Do we get to pull the plug?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ooh! I wanna pull it!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Why should you get to pull it?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, come on!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I asked!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, let me sleep on it, I'll let you know tomorrow. (Eh! Listen to me, talkin' about tomorrow. How brave of me.)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, hello there! Joey Deluxe must've sent you.

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, Space Ghost, and a howdy doody to you too!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Identify yourself, space man!

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: Commander Ozone, Defender of.. the Universe!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (aside) Joey was right, he's perfect! (to Marc) Commander, have you ever seen my show?

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: Oh no... Dear...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I'd like you to meet Zorak. He'll be your bandleader. Have you ever worked with a mantis?

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: No I haven't. Maybe you want to tell me about him.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He's over there on your left.

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: (waves stick) Bad! (waves stick again) Ow! Just hit myself on the head with the stick.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) (Hey, I just laughed. That is so brave of me.)

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: Uh oh!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (... so very brave to laugh...)

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: I'm havin' a little problem here. (his earphone is falling out, he tries to fix it with the puppet's miniature hand) Wait, wait a minute, I'll get that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (... when dying...)

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: (his earphone has fallen out) I can't hear you, Space Ghost, we're havin' a, it must be a meteor breakin' us up.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Never mind that, Commander. Now listen up. After I begin my journey across the river Styx, I still want the name of my show to be Space Ghost Coast to Coast, so you're going to have to change your name to Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, but I'm a Commander! Commander Ozone! My real name is Herbert.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, Herbert, your name is Space Ghost. Say it with me: Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: (in unison) Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Congratulations, son, you've got the job. I know you'll make me proud.

transcript.speaker: Marc Weiner
transcript.dialogue: Thank you, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, thank YOU, Space Ghost. (Marc fades from monitor)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So, you're really dyin', huh?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yup, can you believe it?

transcript.speaker: Zorak & Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's cold, not believing a dying man. (coughs twice unconvincingly again)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well, we've got a doctor here to give you a second opinion.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You do?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Sure do.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A doctor.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's right, sweetie.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hm. Well, I have no problem with that. A real doctor?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yep.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I have no problem with that, send him in.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, Doctor.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Greetings.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: They say I have a terminal illness.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: And who, who told you you have that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A doctor.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Are you a ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: But I mean, are you a phantom or are you a ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm Space Ghost. Should I take my clothes off?

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Well, I'm, I, if we're going to...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Because I don't mind getting a thorough examination.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: What was the, what was the problem again?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Dying, illness, impending death.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: But, does the illness have a name?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: They didn't specify. So, do I take my clothes off yet?

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Let me, let me keep going with the history before we get on with the taking, taking the clothes off part.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Right. Sometimes it hurts when I sit down. Is that bad?

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: I, I'm ... Can we talk about something else?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I swallowed a bolt once, is that bad?

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: A what?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A bolt.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Really. Is that part of the, you know, nutrients spectrum for Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, dummy, it's metal. Who eats metal?

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Okay. And, do you have parents?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who doesn't?

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Do they have medical problems? Are they still alive?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Right.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Ah. (pause) Space Ghost, you're not a very good historian.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Right, so I should take my clothes off.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: (trying to keep a straight face) Alright.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Or I should wait.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Do you have a cardiovascular system?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What is this, Eleven Questions? Yes, of course I have a vardiocascular system!

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Does it resemble the humanoid system?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Pretty much, except for the no-blood part.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: What does it pump around, by the way, if not blood?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, you know. Juices and such.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Okay. And is there a digestive system?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Most definitely.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Oh. Yours is having problems?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It is? Well, that seems to be the problem then.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Ah. That, that's where the disease is, in the digestive system.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, it's gotta be, right? Where else could it be?

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I'll take your word for it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're the doctor.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Yes, absolutely.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Doctor, break it to the universe how long I've got to live.

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: Um, given that you would not do this as a ratings ploy, and I genuinely believe your sincerity, let's say death is imminent.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (blasts Zorak with his destructo ray)

transcript.speaker: Drew Pinsky
transcript.dialogue: I, I hope you're gonna be, uh, okay with the news.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I'll get by. (monitor raises to ceiling) Somehow. (alarm clock bell sound) Well, it's.. time for me to die. (gets up and walks in front of desk) Ah. (falls down)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still lying on the floor) (opens his eyes) Huh. This isn't so bad.
